board.name: Akash Bobba
board.bio: Akash is a student at West Windsor-Plainsboro High School South. Aside from CJSIA, he is passionate about computer science, physics, and international policy. He awarded in his school's Model United Nations team (South MUN), in the South Debate Team, and is the Secretary of the South Camerata Orchestra. He also pursues his interests outside school by competing in the Silver Division of USACO, in various hackathons/information security CTF tournaments, and by playing hockey recreationally. Akash is excited to lead CJSIA throughout the coming seasons, working alongside students and the dedicated board to spread entrepreneurship skills and foster innovation.

board.name: Rishi Madala
board.bio: Rishi is a sophomore at West Windsor-Plainsboro High School South and prides himself in being a well-rounded individual. Within his school, he is the captain of the high school basketball team, a part of the HSS Model United Nations team and an officer of the HSS Business Club. Rishi is also involved in his local community as he is a mentor in the Tutoring Desk and Study Buddy programs. He is very excited to serve as the Vice-President for CJSIA for 2019 and years to come and empower students on the basis of innovation and entrepreneurship to facilitate the development of real-world skills.

board.name: Carol Sun
board.bio: Carol is currently a sophomore at West Windsor-Plainsboro High School South. Outside of CJSIA, she has pursued her passions for law, history and research by being a junior officer of Debate Club, as well as co-Vice President of the National History Day program at South. Carol is also a proud member of South’s orchestra program, where she plays violin, and serves as a representative on Student Council. Carol looks forward to serving as a co-logistics officer for CJSIA, as she has great beliefs in the purpose of educating students on the importance of entrepreneurship.

board.name: Bharat Krishan
board.bio: Bharat is a sophomore at West Windsor-Plainsboro High School South with an extensive background in public speaking and who has a strong interest in pursuing law. Outside of school, Bharat is a member of the debate team, awarding at multiple national tournaments including Princeton Moot Court, and the Capitol Beltway Classic. He also is an attorney for his school’s Mock Trial Team and an officer of Business Club. As co-logistics officer for CJSIA, Bharat is excited to share his experience with others others in order to teach real-world skills and innovation.
